docs.snippet: Mark Zuckerberg says he wants to help the news media. Here’s what he needs to do.
It lets people share videos and photographs in the Facebook app that will disappear after 24 hours, similar to the Stories feature on Instagram, also owned by Facebook.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Mimics a Feature From Snapchat
headline.main: Facebook Mirrors Snapchat (Again) With Stories Feature

docs.snippet: If you find yourself getting a friend request from someone who has died, report the incident to Facebook.
Palmer Luckey’s departure came after a trial over allegations that he had stolen trade secrets from ZeniMax Media to create the Oculus’s virtual-reality technology.

headline.print_headline: Oculus Founder, at Center of Legal Battle Over VR, Departs Facebook
headline.main: Oculus Founder, at Center of Legal Battle Over VR, Departs Facebook

docs.snippet: Closing your social media accounts can help protect your privacy, but it can also mean cutting yourself off from friends, family and opportunity.

headline.print_headline: Want to Disappear From Facebook and Twitter? First, Know the Perks and Pitfalls
headline.main: How to Log Off of Facebook Forever, With All Its Perks and Pitfalls

docs.snippet: The picture of Anas Modamani with the German chancellor was used in fake news posts about terrorism, and he wanted the social media giant to prevent its use.

headline.print_headline: German Court Refuses to Block Facebook Users From Reposting a Refugee’s Selfie
headline.main: Selfie With Merkel by Refugee Became a Legal Case, but Facebook Won in German Court

docs.snippet: The minister of justice said he would introduce a law requiring penalties for tech companies that did not respond quickly enough to delete illegal posts.

headline.print_headline: Germany Threatens to Fine Facebook and Twitter Over Hate Speech
headline.main: Facebook and Twitter Could Face Fines in Germany Over Hate Speech Posts

docs.snippet: In considering a North Carolina law that bars sex offenders from using some social media, the Supreme Court discussed how such platforms have transformed civic life.

headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Considers Case for a Constitutional Right to Facebook and Twitter
headline.main: A Constitutional Right to Facebook and Twitter? Supreme Court Weighs In

docs.snippet: The move by Facebook highlights a growing debate over how and when the social network should moderate the mass of content on its site.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Turns In BBC After Being Shown Child Sex Images From Site
headline.main: Facebook Reports BBC to Police Over Investigation Into Child Sex Images

docs.snippet: A Syrian refugee’s 2015 picture with Germany’s chancellor came to symbolize her decision to welcome migrants. But it has been used to falsely link him to terrorism.

headline.print_headline: How a Refugee’s Selfie Could Change Facebook
headline.main: How a Refugee’s Selfie With Merkel Led to a Facebook Lawsuit
